name: slack
description: MCP server for Slack integration providing channel management, messaging, user operations, and workspace interactions

tools.name: slack_list_channels
tools.description: List all channels in the Slack workspace. Returns both public channels you're a member of and all public channels if you have appropriate permissions. Useful for discovering channels before posting messages or getting channel info.

limit.description: Maximum number of channels to return (default: 100, max: 1000)

types.description: Comma-separated list of channel types: public_channel, private_channel, mpim, im (default: public_channel)

tools.name: slack_post_message
tools.description: Post a new message to a Slack channel or direct message. Supports rich formatting with Slack's mrkdwn format, thread replies, and message blocks for interactive content.

channel.description: Channel ID or name (with #) to post to

thread_ts.description: Thread timestamp to reply in a thread (optional)

blocks.description: Array of Slack Block Kit blocks for rich formatting

tools.name: slack_get_channel_history
tools.description: Retrieve message history from a Slack channel. Returns recent messages with user info, timestamps, and thread information. Useful for reading context before responding.

channel.description: Channel ID to get history from

limit.description: Number of messages to retrieve (default: 10, max: 100)

oldest.description: Only messages after this Unix timestamp (inclusive)

latest.description: Only messages before this Unix timestamp (exclusive)

tools.name: slack_add_reaction
tools.description: Add an emoji reaction to a Slack message. Reactions are a lightweight way to acknowledge messages without sending a full reply.

timestamp.description: Timestamp of the message to react to

tools.name: slack_get_users
tools.description: List all users in the Slack workspace with their profile information including display name, real name, email, and status.

limit.description: Maximum number of users to return (default: 100)

tools.name: slack_create_channel
tools.description: Create a new public or private channel in the Slack workspace. You must have permission to create channels in the workspace.

name.description: Channel name (lowercase, no spaces, may contain dashes and underscores)

tools.name: slack_invite_to_channel
tools.description: Invite one or more users to a Slack channel. You must be a member of the channel to invite others.

channel.description: Channel ID to invite users to

users.description: Array of user IDs to invite

tools.name: slack_upload_file
tools.description: Upload a file to a Slack channel or direct message. Supports various file types with optional title and comment.

channels.description: Array of channel IDs to share the file in

file.description: File content as base64 encoded string

initial_comment.description: Message to post with the file

tools.name: slack_search_messages
tools.description: Search for messages across all channels you have access to. Supports Slack's search syntax for filtering by user, channel, date, etc.

count.description: Number of results to return (default: 20, max: 100)
